channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Lampposts with flags, 13th September
item.description:
Five lampposts have had flags tied to them all along the lower section of Charlton lane This is an eye sore, a fire hazard, is done with unwanted political intentions as is causing discomfort to all in the area Please can we get all flags removed at the earliest opportunity. Thanks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pound Park Road, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Smoke and burnt meat smell, 13th September
item.description:
I have reported this issue sooo many times in the last 5 months and absolutely no one seems to care. Strangers are coming to this garden and bbq industrial amount of meat all day , filling our home with smoke and foul meat smell

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Wick Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked Drain Again, 13th September
item.description:
This drain is once again blocked and causes flooding every time it rains. This road flooded in the past and to see this flooding on the road every time it rains is stressful. I reported it last week and was told it was sorted. Clearly, it is still acting up. Can this be seen to properly please?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Essendine Road, Kensal Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter and fly tipping needs cleaning, 13th September
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mount Pleasant Hill, Hackney, London

item.title: Broken glass., 13th September
item.description:
Following a huge fight in the street between 3am and 4am this morning (I have video footage and a car’s licence plate) there is a lot of broken glass on Grange Road at 9am today.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Grange Road, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti on road, 13th September
item.description:
Previously case was reported as fixed. It’s not. Rain is not washing away the “TRG” graffiti in the road. It was put there by a running group for the big half. See photo attached from last night.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tooley Street, Bermondsey, London

item.title: The metal bin lids have been stolen from all bins on Winn common, 13th September
item.description:
The 4 metal bin lids that keep rubbish from overflowing have been stolen/ removed in the very recent past. There is now an issue with foxes and litter being strewn all over the common. These is relevant to 4 bins on Winn common and near the paddling pool ( near the road on the common)
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Winn Common Road, Plumstead, London

item.title: Fridge dumped (Stevenson Cres), 13th September
item.description:
An elderly man has dumped a fridge on Stevenson Crescent. This happened on Monday 8th September around 9pm. I confronted the man, but he didn’t seem fully mentally present..

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lynton Road, Bermondsey, London
